wikipedia_page.main:
Julian Frederick "Fred" Howard was an English professional footballer of the 1920s.
Born in Long Eaton, he joined Gillingham from Derby County in 1920 and went on to make 18 appearances for the club in The Football League, scoring three goals. He left to join Ayr United in 1922.

response: * Frederick Howard, 5th Earl of Carlisle (1748–1825), English diplomat
* Frederick Howard (footballer), English footballer active in the 1920s with Derby County, Gillingham and Ayr United
* Frederick Howard (British Army officer) (1785–1815), fought in the Napoleonic Wars and was killed at the Battle of Waterloo
